section.p: Well, I don't know why I made 3 TLE(Time Limit Exceed) and 1 WA(Wrong Answer) before the AC(Accepted) arrived, but anyway it is not a difficult problem in fact. At the very beginning, I just search the interval between n and m and count the number. And that's the solution 1. However, it takes too much time to search the interval when it is asked. So we can use a way just like prefix sum that we'll preprocess an array with the number of the lucky numbers(just like the array count in the Solution 2). When we read each pair of n and m, all we need to do is to subtract the number of the lucky numbers from 0 to n-1 from the one from 0 to m. Although it takes much time in preprocessing, but it can reduce the time of searching from O(n) to O(1). So I get the AC with the code given as Solution 2 in the code part.
